member.name: M:Microsoft.Health.HealthVaultPlatform.GetTransformedItems(Microsoft.Health.ApplicationConnection,Microsoft.Health.HealthRecordAccessor,Microsoft.Health.HealthRecordSearcher,System.String)
member.summary: Gets the health record items specified by the and runs them through the specified transform.
member.param: The connection to use to access the data.
The record to use.
The searcher that defines what items to return.
A URL to a transform to run on the resulting XML. This can be a fully-qualified URL or the name of one of the standard XSLs provided by the HealthVault system.
member.returns: The string resulting from performing the specified transform on the XML representation of the items.
member.remarks:
This method accesses the HealthVault service across the network.
Any call to HealthVault may specify a transform to be run on the response XML. The transform can be specified as a XSL fragment or a well-known transform tag provided by the HealthVault service. If a XSL fragment is specified, it gets compiled and cached on the server.
A final-xsl is useful when you want to convert the result from XML to HTML so that you can display the result directly in a web page. You may also use it to generate other data formats like CCR, CCD, CSV, RSS, etc.
Transform fragments cannot contain embedded script. The following set of parameters are passed to all final-xsl transforms:
currentDateTimeUtc - the date and time just before the transform started executing
requestingApplicationName - the name of the application that made the request to HealthVault.
countryCode - the ISO 3166 country code from the request.
languageCode - the ISO 639-1 language code from the request.
personName - the name of the person making the request.
recordName - if the request identified a HealthVault record to be used, this parameter contains the name of that record.
member.exception: The parameter is null or empty.
does not contain the XML section in the view.
There is a failure retrieving the items. -or- No filters have been specified.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Health.HealthVaultPlatform.CreateConnectPackage(Microsoft.Health.Package.ConnectPackageCreationParameters,Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.PasswordProtectedPackage)
member.summary: Asks HealthVault to create a pending package for the application specified by the connection with the specified user specific parameters and the pre-allocated identity code.
member.remarks:
The password protected package supports 2 encryption algorithms, AES256 (recommended) and TripleDES.
For AES256, the supported key size is 256 bits, the blocksize is 256 bits, the IV length is 32 bytes.
For TripleDES, the supported key size is 192 bits, the blocksize is 64 bits, the IV length is 8 bytes.
The encryption key should be derived using the answer, the salt, and the number of hash iterations. The decryption will generate this key via the class, hence, encryption should use a similar or identical process. To ensure case-insensitivity, the answer should be converted to its lower cased form using (culturally-agnostic) prior to generating the derived key.
The algorithm used has the following parameters:
Mode = CipherMode.CBC
Padding = PaddingMode.ISO10126
The salt supplied is used as the salt to the derived key as well as the key to the supplied HMAC. The salt should be at least 8 bytes long.
It is recommended that the number of hash iterations be at least 10000.
member.param: The parameters to use when creating the package.

The pending connect package that the user will add to his/her record. This package's 's must be an encrypted blob of xml that represents a list of HealthRecordItems. This xml blob must be a sequence of elements, each wrapping the XML representation of a single HealthRecordItem. Each element may be generated by calling .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Health.HealthVaultPlatform.AllocateConnectPackageId(Microsoft.Health.Web.OfflineWebApplicationConnection)
member.summary: Allocates a package ID within HealthVault and returns it.

remarks.para: The package ID is allocated as a place holder for information that is identifiable but not yet available through the HealthVault service. The returned package ID token should be stored or given to a patient, then used in a call to CreateConnectPackage() to send the package data to the HealthVault service.

The package ID is not a GUID. It uses a shorter format that is more convenient for offline delivery and manual data entry. The HealthVault service guarantees that each package ID is unique for the lifetime of the package. Once the package has been accepted by the patient using the HealthVault Shell, or explicitly deleted using the API, the package ID is deallocated and may be reused.

member.param: The HealthVault connection to use for the operation.
member.returns: A token that the application must give to the patient to use when validating the connection request.
member.exception: If is null.
If an error occurs when contacting HealthVault.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Health.PlatformPrimitives.HealthVaultPlatformItem.GetTransformedItems(Microsoft.Health.ApplicationConnection,Microsoft.Health.HealthRecordAccessor,Microsoft.Health.HealthRecordSearcher,System.String)
member.summary: Gets the health record items specified by the and runs them through the specified transform.
member.param: The connection to use to access the data.
The record to use.
The searcher that defines what items to return.
A URL to a transform to run on the resulting XML. This can be a fully-qualified URL or the name of one of the standard XSLs provided by the HealthVault system.
member.returns: The string resulting from performing the specified transform on the XML representation of the items.
member.remarks:
This method accesses the HealthVault service across the network.
Any call to HealthVault may specify a transform to be run on the response XML. The transform can be specified as a XSL fragment or a well-known transform tag provided by the HealthVault service. If a XSL fragment is specified, it gets compiled and cached on the server.
A final-xsl is useful when you want to convert the result from XML to HTML so that you can display the result directly in a web page. You may also use it to generate other data formats like CCR, CCD, CSV, RSS, etc.
Transform fragments cannot contain embedded script. The following set of parameters are passed to all final-xsl transforms:
currentDateTimeUtc - the date and time just before the transform started executing
requestingApplicationName - the name of the application that made the request to HealthVault.
countryCode - the ISO 3166 country code from the request.
languageCode - the ISO 639-1 language code from the request.
personName - the name of the person making the request.
recordName - if the request identified a HealthVault record to be used, this parameter contains the name of that record.
member.exception: The parameter is null or empty.
does not contain the XML section in the view.
There is a failure retrieving the items. -or- No filters have been specified.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Health.PlatformPrimitives.HealthVaultPlatformPatientConnect.CreateConnectPackage(Microsoft.Health.Package.ConnectPackageCreationParameters,Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.PasswordProtectedPackage)
member.summary: Asks HealthVault to create a pending package for the application specified by the connection with the specified user specific parameters and the pre-allocated identity code.
member.remarks:
The password protected package supports 2 encryption algorithms, AES256 (recommended) and TripleDES.
For AES256, the supported key size is 256 bits, the blocksize is 256 bits, the IV length is 32 bytes.
For TripleDES, the supported key size is 192 bits, the blocksize is 64 bits, the IV length is 8 bytes.
The encryption key should be derived using the answer, the salt, and the number of hash iterations. The decryption will generate this key via the class, hence, encryption should use a similar or identical process. To ensure case-insensitivity, the answer should be converted to its lower cased form using (culturally-agnostic) prior to generating the derived key.
The algorithm used has the following parameters:
Mode = CipherMode.CBC
Padding = PaddingMode.ISO10126
The salt supplied is used as the salt to the derived key as well as the key to the supplied HMAC. The salt should be at least 8 bytes long.
It is recommended that the number of hash iterations be at least 10000.
member.param: The parameters to use when creating the package.

The pending connect package that the user will add to his/her record. This package's 's must be an encrypted blob of xml that represents a list of HealthRecordItems. This xml blob must be a sequence of elements, each wrapping the XML representation of a single HealthRecordItem. Each element may be generated by calling .
member.returns: A token that the application must give to the patient to use when validating the connection request.
member.exception: If an error occurs when contacting HealthVault.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Health.PlatformPrimitives.HealthVaultPlatformRecord.GetValidGroupMembership(Microsoft.Health.ApplicationConnection,Microsoft.Health.HealthRecordAccessor,System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.Guid})
member.summary: Gets valid group memberships for a record.
member.remarks:
Group membership thing types allow an application to signify that the record belongs to an application defined group. A record in the group may be eligible for special programs offered by other applications, for example. Applications then need a away to query for valid group memberships.
Valid group memberships are those memberships which are not expired, and whose last updating application is authorized by the the last updating person to read and delete the membership.
member.param: The connection to use to access the data.
The record to use.

A collection of unique application identifiers for which to search for group memberships. For a null or empty application identifier list, return all valid group memberships for the record. Otherwise, return only those group memberships last updated by one of the supplied application identifiers.
member.returns: A List of HealthRecordItems representing the valid group memberships.
member.exception: If an error occurs while contacting the HealthVault service.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Health.PlatformPrimitives.HealthVaultPlatformVocabulary.GetVocabulary(Microsoft.Health.HealthServiceConnection,System.Collections.Generic.IList{Microsoft.Health.VocabularyKey},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Retrieves lists of vocabulary items for the specified vocabularies and culture.
member.param: The connection to use for this operation. The connection must have application capability.
A list of keys identifying the requested vocabularies.

HealthVault looks for the vocabulary items for the culture info specified using . If is set to false and if items are not found for the specified culture, items for the default fallback culture are returned. If is set to true, fallback will not occur, and if items are not found for the specified culture, empty strings are returned.
member.returns: The specified vocabularies and their items, or empty strings.
member.exception: The list is empty.
The list is null or contains a null entry.

There is an error in the server request.
-Or-
One of the requested vocabularies is not found on the server.
-Or-
One of the requested vocabularies does not contain representations for its items for the specified culture when is true.
-Or-
There is an error loading the vocabulary.

member.summary: Searches a specific vocabulary and retrieves the matching vocabulary items.

member.param: The connection to use for this operation. The connection must have application capability.

The defining the vocabulary to search. If the family is not specified, the default HealthVault vocabulary family is used. If the version is not specified, the most current version of the vocabulary is used.
The search string to use.
The type of search to perform.
The maximum number of results to return. If null, all matching results are returned, up to a maximum number defined by the service config value with key maxResultsPerVocabularyRetrieval.

A ReadOnlyCollection of with entries matching the search criteria.

if is not a known value.

when is defined but has a value less than 1.

members.member:
The public HealthVault methods that are available for applications to call.
Note, the numeric value is not important. These values don't map directly to the platform method enum values.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Health.HealthVaultMethods.CreateAuthenticatedSessionToken
member.summary: Creates an application session token for use with the HealthVault service.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Health.HealthVaultMethods.DeleteOpenQuery
member.summary: Removes a saved open query.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Health.HealthVaultMethods.GetApplicationInfo
member.summary: Gets information about the registered application including name, description, authorization rules, and callback url.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Health.HealthVaultMethods.GetApplicationSettings
member.summary: Saves application specific information for the logged in user.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Health.HealthVaultMethods.GetAuthorizedRecords
member.summary: Gets all the records that the user has authorized the application use.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Health.HealthVaultMethods.GetOpenQueryInfo
member.summary: Gets existing saved open queries.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Health.HealthVaultMethods.GetPersonInfo
member.summary: Gets information about the logged in user.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Health.HealthVaultMethods.GetServiceDefinition
member.summary: Gets generic service information about the HealthVault service.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Health.HealthVaultMethods.GetThings
member.summary: Gets data from a HealthVault record.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Health.HealthVaultMethods.GetThingType
member.summary: Gets information, including schemas, about the data types that can be stored in a health record.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Health.HealthVaultMethods.GetVocabulary
member.summary: Gets information about clinical and other vocabularies that HealthVault supports.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Health.HealthVaultMethods.PutThings
member.summary: Adds or updates data in a health record.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Health.HealthVaultMethods.QueryPermissions
member.summary: Gets the permissions that the application and user have to a health record.

member.summary: Removes data from a health record.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Health.HealthVaultMethods.SaveOpenQuery
member.summary: Creates a saved open query.

member.summary: Sends an SMTP message on behalf of the logged in user.

member.summary: Sets application specific data for the user.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Health.OpenQuery
member.summary: Represents a saved HealthVault service method invocation that can be invoked any time by anyone through a query-specific URL.
member.remarks:
instances are inherently insecure. Therefore, store the URL to the instance securely and do not share it.
An is created using the static
or
method, which returns an instance that contains the query ID and URL to the . Reference an existing using one of the class constructors. The query ID can either be explicitly specified or parsed from the URL, depending on which constructor is used.

member.summary: Invokes the open query with the specified timeout and returns the results.
member.param: The time in milliseconds before the invocation of the query will timeout.
member.returns: A string representing the invocation results.

member.remarks:
This method makes a network call to the web service.
The XML provided by must have the outer node "<app-settings>" or the request will fail.
member.exception: An error is returned from the server when making the request.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Health.PersonInfo.GetSelfRecord
member.summary: Gets the for the first health record that has a relationship of with the person.
member.returns: The first having the relationship with the person.
member.remarks: Since a person may have more than one or no records, this method returns an error if the person does not have a self record, but it returns the first self record if they have multiple records. There is no guarantee that the first record will always be the same one.
member.exception: The person does not have an authorized record with the relationship that is in the Active state with the authorization expiration date anytime in the future.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Health.PersonInfo.PersonId
member.summary: Gets or sets the HealthVault unique identifier for the person.
member.value: A GUID that is assigned to the account when it was created.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Health.PersonInfo.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the person's name.
member.value: The person's full name as it was entered into HealthVault.
member.remarks: The person's full name can be changed only by going to the HealthVault Shell.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Health.PersonInfo.ApplicationSettings
member.summary: Gets or sets the application settings for the current application and person.
member.remarks: This can be null if no application settings have been stored for the application or user.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Health.PersonInfo.ApplicationSettingsDocument
member.summary: Gets or sets the underlying application settings document.
member.remarks: This property should only be used for testing.

member.name: E:Microsoft.Health.PersonInfo.ApplicationSettingsChanged
member.summary: Occurs when changes the application settings in HealthVault.
member.remarks: This event is not triggered if another instance of the PersonInfo gets updated or if the value changes in HealthVault. The sender is the PersonInfo instance that was updated. The event args are empty.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Health.PersonInfo.SelectedRecord
member.summary: Gets or sets the record the person has chosen to use as the default record for the current application.
member.value: A representing the record the person has chosen to use as the default record for the current application.
member.remarks:
Note that this property is only applicable to single-record applications (SRAs).
A value of null indicates that no record has been selected or that the person does not have sufficient rights to the record to use it with the current application.
Setting the selected record through will only change the selected record for this instance. Other instances of the for the same person will have the original selected record. The user can set their selected record through the HealthVault Shell.

member.name: E:Microsoft.Health.PersonInfo.SelectedRecordChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the setter is called.
member.remarks: This event is not triggered if another instance of the PersonInfo gets updated or if the value changes in HealthVault. The sender is the PersonInfo instance that was updated. The event args are empty.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Health.PersonInfo.AuthorizedRecords
member.summary: Gets or sets the authorized record for the person.
member.value: The records that the person is authorized to access.
member.remarks:
A person can access their own health record, health records that they have created for other people, or health records that other people have shared with them. The contents of this collection will be all the health records, including those that have been deleted or suspended. A person can interact only with active records.
Shortcuts are provided to get access to the person's own health record using and specific records using by ID.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Health.PersonInfo.PreferredCulture
member.summary: Gets or sets the user's preferred culture.
member.remarks: The preferred culture should be used when formatting date/time, numbers, collating, etc.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Health.PersonInfo.PreferredUICulture
member.summary: Gets or sets the user's preferred UI culture.
member.remarks: The preferred UI culture should be used when retrieving text from resources for display to the user.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Health.ResourceRetriever
member.summary: Helps manage ResourceManager instances.
member.remarks: Due to the heavy-weight nature of ResourceManager it is a good idea to cache instances whenever possible. This class uses a static member to cache all ResourceManager instances that have been retrieved using the assembly and base name.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Health.ResourceRetriever._resourceRetriever
member.summary: Maintains a cache of ResourceManager objects. This is a dictionary that is keyed based on the full name of the default resource assembly. The value is another dictionary that is keyed based on the base name for the resource that is being retrieved. The value for this dictionary is the ResourceManager.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Health.ResourceRetriever._stringResources
member.summary: Maintains a cache of string resources. This dictionary is keyed based on the instance from which the string resource was retrieved.
member.remarks: This cache is only used if GetResourceString or FormatResourceString is used to retrieve the resource. If the caller calls GetResourceManager the resources returned from the ResourceManager instance are not cached here though they may be cached by the ResourceManager under some circumstances. According to the BCL team they made a change to ResourceManager to cache resources less frequently.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Health.ResourceRetriever.syncRoot

member.returns: A ResourceManager instance for the assembly and base name that were specified.

member.summary: Gets or sets the version of the HealthVault service.
member.value: A string indicating the version of the HealthVault Service.
member.remarks: This value is generally in the format of a , but can be changed by the HealthVault service provider.

member.summary: Gets or sets the latest information about the HealthVault Shell.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Health.ServiceInfo.Assemblies
member.summary: Gets the latest information about the assemblies that represent the HealthVault SDK.
member.value: A read-only collection of information about the .NET assemblies that can be used as helpers for accessing the HealthVault service.
member.remarks: This property is no longer supported and will always return an empty collection.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Health.ServiceInfo.Methods
member.summary: Gets or sets information about the methods that the HealthVault service exposes.
member.value: A read-only collection of the HealthVault method definitions.
member.remarks: A HealthVault method is a named service point provided by the HealthVault service that answers HTTP requests that contain XML adhering to the HealthVault request schema. The elements of this collection define the method name, and request and response schemas for the method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Health.ServiceInfo.IncludedSchemaUrls
member.summary: Gets or sets the URLs of the common schemas that are included in the method XSDs.
member.value: A read-only collection containing the URLs of the schemas that are included in the request and response schemas.
member.remarks: Many of the contain types that are common across different method requests and responses. These types are defined in the included schema URLs so that they can be referenced by each of the methods as needed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Health.ServiceInfo.ConfigurationValues
member.summary: Gets or sets the public configuration values for the HealthVault service.
member.value: The dictionary returned uses the configuration value name as the key. All entries are public configuration values that the HealthVault service exposes as information to HealthVault applications. Values can be used to throttle health record item queries, etc.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypeManager.RegisterExtensionHandler(System.String,System.Type)
member.summary: Registers a deserializer for item extension data.
member.remarks:
Extension data is available to all applications, and since there is no registration method for the extensionSource identifiers, collisions between applications are possible.
Applications should be written to be tolerant of the presence of extension data using the same extensionSource but a different schema. It is also recommended that extensionSource be specified the same way .NET namespaces are specified, prefixing the extensionSource with the company name.
member.param: The unique identifier for the source of the item extension.
The class that implements the item extension. It must be public, derive from , and have a default constructor.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Health.Web.WebApplicationConnection
member.summary: Represents an authenticated interface to HealthVault.
member.remarks:
Most operations performed against the service require authentication. A connection must be made to HealthVault to access the web methods that the service exposes. The class does not maintain an open connection to the service. It uses XML over HTTP to make requests and receive responses from the service. The connection just maintains the data necessary to make the request.
An authenticated connection takes the user name and password, and authenticates against HealthVault and then stores an authentication token which is then passed to the service on each subsequent request. An authenticated connection is required for accessing a person's health record.
For operations that do not require authentication, the or class can be used.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Health.Events.NotificationAuthenticationSharedKeyInfo.Version
member.summary: A string representing the version of the key.
member.remarks:
The version can only consist of the characters "A-Z", "a-z", "0-9", and "-".
The version of the key is passed with the notification in the request headers. The application that processes this notification can use it to determine which key it should use to authenticate the notification (the key is not passed as part of the notification).
When an update is made to a subscription notification deliveries may use either the old key or the updated key to calculate the notification payload HMAC for a short period of time. The key version id is sent with the notification, allowing the app to determine which key was used to calculate the notification payload HMAC.
member.exception: The is empty or contains illegal characters.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Health.Events.NotificationAuthenticationSharedKeyInfo.Key
member.summary: The key that is used for the operation.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Health.Events.SubscriptionManager
member.summary: The SubscriptionManager class is used to manage an application's eventing subscriptions.
member.remarks:
A subscription allows an application to receive a notification when a specific event happens on the HealthVault platform. For example, an application may wish to be notified when any BloodGlucose items are added to the records it is authorized to see.
Subscriptions are described by the class and classes that are derived from it.
The Subscription class itself contains the class, storing the notification channel (which defines how the information is communicated to the application) and a unique id for the subscription.
The derived class denotes the type of event that the subscription describes (for example, the class subscribes to item changes in a record) and any specific information that is required for the subscription.
